Name: Feeding America
Short Description: Feeding America is a nationwide network dedicated to providing nutritious food to communities through food banks, pantries, and meal programs, emphasizing both sourcing donations and advocating for hunger-ending policies.
Long Description:
Feeding America is a nationwide network of food banks, food pantries and local meal programs. Our common goal is simple: help people get the food and resources they need to thrive.

Everything we do focuses on getting nutritious food to communities – from sourcing food donations to advocating for policies that end hunger.

Name: United Way Worldwide
Short Description: United Way globally mobilizes communities to advance the common good, fostering strong, equitable communities through partnerships and addressing challenges in education, economic mobility, and health, impacting 48 million lives annually with the support of 1.5 million volunteers and 6.8 million donors.
Long Description:
United Way seeks to improve lives by mobilizing the caring power of communities around the world to advance the common good.

United Way brings people together to build strong, equitable communities where everyone can thrive. As one of the world's largest privately funded charities, we serve 95% of U.S. communities and 37 countries and territories -- making life better for 48 million people every year. Through United Way, communities tackle tough challenges and work with private, public, and nonprofit partners to boost education, economic mobility, and health resources.

United Way is the mission of choice for 1.5 million volunteers, 6.8 million donors, and 45,000 corporate partners in more than 1,100 communities worldwide. In our second century of service, we're building resilient, equitable communities across the globe.

Name: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital
Short Description: St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital aims to cure pediatric catastrophic diseases through research and treatment, ensuring no child is denied care based on race, religion, or financial means, with a commitment to providing cost-free treatment and achieving a 100% survival goal, impacting children globally.
Long Description:
The mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital is to advance cures, and means of prevention, for pediatric catastrophic diseases through research and treatment. Consistent with the vision of our founder Danny Thomas, no child is denied treatment based on race, religion or a family's ability to pay.

Cost to family: $0
Families never receive a bill from St. Jude for treatment, travel, housing or food — so they can focus on helping their child live.

Saving kids worldwide
St. Jude has treated children from all 50 states and from around the world.

Our goal: 100% survival
Treatments developed at St. Jude have helped push the overall childhood cancer survival rate from 20% to more than 80% since it opened more than 60 years ago.

Name: Salvation Army
Short Description: The Salvation Army, an international evangelical movement rooted in the Christian Church, is dedicated to preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ and addressing human needs in God's name without discrimination.
Long Description: The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian Church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.

Name: Direct Relief
Short Description: Direct Relief is a humanitarian aid organization, active in all 50 states and more than 80 countries, with a mission to improve the health and lives of people affected by poverty or emergencies – without regard to politics, religion, or ability to pay.
Long Description: Direct Relief is driven by a humanitarian imperative to aid those facing threats from disease, poverty, or disaster, focusing on medically underserved communities globally and in the U.S. The organization strengthens health systems, partners with leading entities, supports existing healthcare providers, and ensures transparent access to essential medical resources. With a commitment to value for money, it emphasizes efficient operations, modest expenses, and responsiveness to emergencies, all while promoting inclusivity, non-discrimination, and high-impact partnerships to benefit people in need.

Name: Good 360
Short Description: Good360, the global leader in product philanthropy, partners with major corporations to source essential goods, distributing them through a diverse nonprofit network to close the need gap and create opportunities for people in need worldwide.
Long Description: Good360’s mission is to close the need gap. As the global leader in product philanthropy and purposeful giving, we partner with some of the world’s largest corporations to source essential goods and distribute them through our network of diverse nonprofits, supporting people in need to open opportunity for all.

Name: Goodwill Industries International
Short Description: Goodwill helps people improve their lives by assisting individuals to find a job and grow their careers.
Long Description: Goodwill Industries International, based in Rockville, MD, is a global network of over 150 community-based organizations in the U.S., Canada, and 12 other countries. Founded over 120 years ago, Goodwill helps over 2.1 million individuals annually by providing job training, career growth, and supportive services. With a mission to enhance dignity and quality of life, Goodwill operates as innovative social enterprises, selling donated items in over 3,200 stores and online. The organization partners with leading brands, aiming to combat unemployment and underemployment while providing diverse opportunities for personal and professional development. Committed to global impact, Goodwill extends its model worldwide to address poverty, unemployment, and challenges in finding jobs.

Name: YMCA of the USA
Short Description: The YMCA, a leading nonprofit, aims to strengthen individuals and communities by providing opportunities to enhance health, support youth, foster connections, and contribute to a more cohesive community for all.
Long Description: The YMCA is the leading nonprofit committed to strengthening individuals and communities across the country. At the Y, we’re here to help you find your “why” – your greater sense of purpose – by connecting you with opportunities to improve your health, support young people, make new friends and contribute to a stronger, more cohesive community for all.

Name: Habitat for Humanity International
Short Description: Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit organization that helps families build and improve places to call home. We believe affordable housing plays a critical role in strong and stable communities.
Long Description: Habitat for Humanity partners with people in your community, and all over the world, to help them build or improve a place they can call home. Habitat homeowners help build their own homes alongside volunteers and pay an affordable mortgage. With your support, Habitat homeowners achieve the strength, stability and independence they need to build a better life for themselves and for their families. Through our 2020 Strategic Plan, Habitat for Humanity will serve more people than ever before through decent and affordable housing.

Name: Americares
Short Description: In times of crisis, we prioritize health through Emergency Programs, ensuring communities prepare for, respond to, and recover from disasters, support Medicine Security globally, provide quality health care through Health Services, and establish sustainable programs strengthening local health centers.
Long Description: When people are in crisis, we make sure that health comes first. Our Emergency Programs help communities prepare for, respond to and recover from disasters. We support Medicine Security for millions of people around the world. Our Health Services deliver quality health care for people who have none. We create and support sustainable programs that strengthen local health centers.

Name: Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Short Description: Ensuring kids succeed involves caring mentors, safe Clubs, and innovative programs designed to empower youth for academic excellence and healthy lives, with a commitment to doing whatever it takes for a great future.
Long Description: We never take a single approach to help kids succeed. It takes caring mentors, such as our trained Club staff. It takes a safe place, like our Clubs that are consistently there for the kids they serve. It takes innovative, quality programs designed to empower youth to excel in school and lead healthy, productive lives. We do whatever it takes to ensure all kids have a great future.

Name: Compassion International
Short Description: As a child-development ministry, we aim to alleviate child poverty in Jesus’ name by empowering local churches through sponsorships and donations to provide individualized care, enabling children to learn, grow, play, and dream freely.
Long Description: We are a child-development ministry dedicated to releasing children from poverty in Jesus’ name. Through sponsorships and donations, we empower local churches to provide individualized and holistic care to children in poverty so they are free to learn, grow, play and dream.

Name: Catholic Charities USA
Short Description: Founded over a century ago, Catholic Charities USA works to alleviate poverty and support people in need through advocacy, disaster relief, and strategic priorities, fostering help and hope across the nation, irrespective of faith.
Long Description:
Catholic Charities USA was founded over a century ago by men and women who believed that the collective efforts of the church to faithfully serve people in need could change the course of poverty in our nation.

At Catholic Charities we help people, regardless of their faith, who are struggling with poverty and other complex issues. At CCUSA, our advocacy and disaster relief programs — and our support of member agencies in our network — is making tangible progress toward providing help and hope to our neighbors across the country.

Our collective efforts focus on a set of strategic priorities that make a difference in the lives of people in need.

Name: Samaritan's Purse
Short Description: Samaritan’s Purse, a nondenominational Christian organization, offers spiritual and physical aid globally since 1970, addressing the needs of those affected by war, poverty, disasters, disease, and famine to share God’s love through Jesus Christ and promote the Gospel worldwide.
Long Description: Samaritan’s Purse is a nondenominational evangelical Christian organization providing spiritual and physical aid to hurting people around the world. Since 1970, Samaritan’s Purse has helped meet needs of people who are victims of war, poverty, natural disasters, disease, and famine with the purpose of sharing God’s love through His Son, Jesus Christ. The organization serves the Church worldwide to promote the Gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ.

Name: Nature Conservancy
Short Description: The Nature Conservancy is a global environmental nonprofit working to create a world where people and nature can thrive.
Long Description: The Nature Conservancy addresses the urgent crises of climate change and biodiversity loss, aiming to act decisively by 2030 through goals like reducing 3 gigatons of CO2 emissions annually, benefiting 100 million people from climate-related emergencies, conserving nearly 10 billion acres of ocean, protecting 1.6 billion acres of land, and preserving over 620,000 miles of rivers. With a focus on natural climate solutions, renewable energy transition, and maintaining climate momentum, the organization emphasizes collaborative partnerships, innovative solutions, and supporting local communities and Indigenous Peoples as key elements in achieving a sustainable and equitable future.
